|availability = T-Mobile customers only |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 09/30/2013 |estreldate = |estprice = 100 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B01MYTAURW |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam1 = 600 |rad1n = 450 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |nqam2 = 600 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== :A tag line of ''802.11ac Concurrent Dual-band AC1900 Router'' :''(600Mbps/2.4GHz*+1300Mbps/5GHz)'' within the [https://github.com/RMerl/asuswrt-merlin/blob/master/release/src/router/www/EN.dict ''ASUSWRT''
source applies] to the RT-AC68U, RT-AC68U v2, RT-AC69U. {{WiFiCert|WFA56214|12/15/2014}} ===T-Mobile Personal Cellspot Router=== ====Support==== * ASUS TM-AC1900 [http://www.asus.com/supportonly/TM-AC1900/ Support page] * [https://support.t-mobile.com/community/coverage/personal-cellspot/wi-fi-cellspot-router '''T-Mobile''' Support page] * [http://cellspotroutersetup.t-mobile.com/ Wi-Fi CellSpot Router setup] * [[ASUS RT-AC68U]] [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68U/ Product Page] http://cellspot.router :Default username is '''admin''' and password is '''password'''. ====Firmware==== *Latest firmware is 3.0.0.4.376_3199. Firmware notes... :Fix CVE-2016-0802 :ACSD: fix no 5ghz auto channel select issue :Samba: fix Badlock bug :Fix possibe memory leak :Fix LPR buffer overflow issue :Fix XSS issue in WDS page :Dropbear: update to version 2016.74 :Openssl: update to version 1.0.2j :Fix nat table chaos caused by miniupnp ====Information==== *T-Mobile released a wireless router rebranded from the RT-AC68U. :The T-Mobile rebranded version has a custom proprietary firmware :that is modified for optimizing the T-Mobile Wi-Fi calling feature. :This router requires a refundable $25 deposit (or none if qualified) for postpaid :plan customers [$99 for retail pricing/prepaid accounts] since this is a lease. *''Notice'': If you got this router as a postpaid customer, keep in mind that T-Mobile expects :it back after you cancel your T-Mobile service or if a coverage line is disconnected :from a family/multiple line account within 45 days after cancellation/disconnection. :Failure to do so may incur a $99 non-return fee. If the router is returned damaged, $25. :[This doesn't apply to prepaid customers or if bought in retail price.] ==See also== {{ASUS AC products}} [[Category:English Documentation]]
